SEARCH
Package seasofyore.core

Class ShipHeading

java.lang.Object
seasofyore.core.ShipHeading
public class ShipHeading extends Object
Represents the heading (position and direction) of a ship on the game board. It calculates the occupied cells of the ship based on its position and direction.

      public ShipHeading(int x, int y, Direction d)
      Constructs a new ShipHeading with the specified position and direction.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the rear of the ship
      y - the y-coordinate of the rear of the ship
      d - the direction the ship is facing

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ShipHeading getInstance(int x, int y, Direction d)
      Creates a new instance of ShipHeading with the specified position and direction.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the rear of the ship
      y - the y-coordinate of the rear of the ship
      d - the direction the ship is facing
      Returns:
      a new instance of ShipHeading

    • getRear

      public int[] getRear()
      Gets the rear position of the ship as an array of coordinates.
      Returns:
      an array where index 0 is the x-coordinate and index 1 is the y-coordinate

    • getDirection

      public Direction getDirection()
      Gets the direction the ship is facing.
      Returns:
      the direction of the ship

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection(Direction d)
      Sets the direction the ship is facing.
      Parameters:
      d - the new direction of the ship

    • setRear

      public void setRear(int x, int y)
      Sets the rear position of the ship.
      Parameters:
      x - the new x-coordinate of the rear
      y - the new y-coordinate of the rear

    • getOccupiedCells

      public List<int[]> getOccupiedCells(int shipLength)
      Calculates the cells occupied by the ship based on its length, starting from the rear.
      Parameters:
      shipLength - the length of the ship
      Returns:
      a list of integer arrays, where each array contains the x and y coordinates of an occupied cell

    • adjustRear

      public void adjustRear(int dx, int dy)
      Adjusts the rear position of the ship by the specified offsets.
      Parameters:
      dx - the change in the x-coordinate
      dy - the change in the y-coordinate
